snippet: Bob McDonnell, the Virginia ex-governor, began the political sales job of his life Wednesday, testifying to stave off conviction on corruption charges.
abstract: Former Virginia Gov Bob McDonnell takes the stand in his corruption trial, testifying that he could not have conspired corruptly with his wife Maureen because they were too estranged to manage it; speaks at length of difficult times his family faced while running for office; couple faces charges of public corruption stemming from $177,000 in loans and gifts showered on their family by businessman Jonnie R Williams Sr.
lead_paragraph: Bob McDonnell, the Virginia ex-governor, began the political sales job of his life Wednesday, testifying to stave off conviction on corruption charges.

headline.main: Ex-Governor Points the Finger at His Wife in a Virginia Trial
headline.print_headline: Former Governor Points Finger at Wife in Their Virginia Trial
